body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.11-17
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/74919
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** -
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome, Android 12 / Chrome
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Log in with  applausetester+...@applause.expensifail.com  Account has at least one workspace. Submission frequency set to "Instantly"

1. Open any workspace chat.
2. Turn off internet connection.
3. Create a manual expense.
4. Open the report of the just created expense.

## Expected Result:
Next step message displays "Waiting for you to approve expense". Approve button in header.

## Actual Result:
Next step message displays "Waiting for your expenses to automatically submit". Submit button in header.

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari

title: [$250] Reorder bottom navigation tabs: Swap Inbox and Reports positions

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
## Overview Update the bottom navigation tab order to place Inbox before Reports. ## Current Tab Order 1. Home 2. Reports 3. Inbox 4. Workspaces 5. Settings ## Proposed Tab Order 1. Home 2. Inbox 3. Reports 4. Workspaces 5. Settings ## Implementation Details The tab order is defined in [`src/components/Navigation/NavigationTabBar/index.tsx`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/components/Navigation/NavigationTabBar/index.tsx). Changes are needed in two places: 1. **Wide layout** (desktop/tablet): Lines 288-394 - swap the order of the Reports and Inbox `PressableWithFeedback` components 2. **Narrow layout** (mobile): Lines 463-559 - swap the order of the Reports and Inbox `PressableWithFeedback` components ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Inbox tab appears as the second tab (after Home) - [ ] Reports tab appears as the third tab (after Inbox) - [ ] Tab functionality remains unchanged - [ ] All platforms (iOS, Android, Web) display the correct order - [ ] Existing tests pass with updated expectations

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.11-17 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80915 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoijsnodijsonjdsoi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Account > Expense rules. 3. Click New rule. 4. Create a rule where when Apple is the merchant, update merchant to Expense. 5. Click Save rule. 6. Go to workspace chat. 7. Create a manual expense with Apple as merchant. 8. Open the expense. ## Expected Result: In Step 4, when creating expense rule, specific merchant name such as Expense or (none) should be forbidden. ## Actual Result: In Step 4, when creating expense rule, specific merchant name such as Expense or (none) is allowed. In Step 8, when expense rule is applied, Merchant field turns empty because of the specific merchant name (Expense or (none)). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d00f5b40-618b-4fed-a3df-0cf0e1d3986b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-17
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80915
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjnoisdjoisjdso@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to Account > Expense rules.
3. Click New rule.
4. Click Merchant > enter Apple > Save.
5. Click Add to a report named > enter any name > Save.
6. Toggle on "Create report if necessary".
7. Click Save rule.
8. Go to workspace chat.
9. Create an empty report.
10. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual.
11. Submit a manual expense with Apple as merchant to workspace chat.

## Expected Result:
Expense will be added to a new report with the name indicated in expense rule in Step 7.

## Actual Result:
Expense is added to the empty report created in Step 9.
Another report with the name in expense rule is created.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Workspace taxes are enabled.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to Account > Expense rules.
3. Click New rule.
4. Create a rule where Tax will change to 5% rate when Merchant is Apple.
5. Click Save.
6. Go to workspace chat.
7. Create an expense with Apple as merchant.
8. Open the expense report.

## Expected Result:
Tax rate will change to 5% as per expense rule.

## Actual Result:
Tax rate still remains as 0% and does not change to 5%.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Action Performed:

- Workspace has per diem rates.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create a per diem expense.
4. Go to workspace settings > Per diem.
5. Select all the rates and delete them all.
6. Go back to workspace chat.
7. Open the per diem expense.
8. Click More > Split > Save.

Per diem expense should be split without issue (production).

## Actual Result:
"Please fix the distance rate error" shows up when no distance rate is involved.

Unknown

title: Report History in New Expensify Does Not Reflect Retried Reimbursement

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10-6
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @abbagail
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769796213458829)

## Action Performed:

1. Have a reimbursement fail due to a bank account issue
2. User later adds or fixes their bank account
3. System automatically retries the reimbursement
4. Open the report in New Expensify
5. View Report History

## Expected Result:
Report History in New Expensify should show that:
The bank account was added or updated
The reimbursement was re-initiated
The report is now paid or in progress
History should match what is shown in Expensify Classic.
## Actual Result:
New Expensify only shows the original failure message
No indication that reimbursement was retried
Admins cannot tell whether payment is already in progress
Classic correctly reflects the updated reimbursement activity.
## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshots for the issue are in slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769796213458829)
